thread.title: Pair charged in Family Dollar robbery
thread.title_full: Pair charged in Family Dollar robbery

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Pair charged in Family Dollar robbery
text:
Two Rochester men have been charged in the robbery of a Family Dollar store in September. Carlos Marquez, and Demetrious Powell, both 29, have been charged with first-degree robbery and third-degree grand larceny, according to Irondequoit Police.
Marquez was arrested on Tuesday. Powell was arrested on Wednesday.
On Sept. 19, Irondequoit Police responded to a report of a robbery at the Family Dollar, 1060 E. Ridge Road. Two employees said they had been robbed by a man with a knife while they were closing the store.
Police say Carlos Marquez, a store employee at the time, was involved in the planning and execution of the robbery, assisted by Powell, who allegedly staged the robbery.
The second employee had no knowledge of the planned robbery, police said.
BLOUDON@Gannett.com
Carlos Marquez,left, and Demetrious Powell. (Photo: Provided photos)
